question: Why is an RNN (Recurrent Neural Network) used for machine translation, say translating Russian to Kazakh? (Check all that apply.)

answers.answer: It can be trained as a supervised learning problem.
answers.feedback: Yes. We can train it on many pairs of sentences x (Russian) and y (Kazakh).

answers.answer: It is strictly more powerful than a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)
It is applicable when the input/output is a sequence (e.g., a sequence of words).
answers.feedback: Yes. An RNN can map from a sequence of Russian words to a sequence of Kazakh words.

answers.answer: RNNs represent the recurrent process of Idea->Code->Experiment->Idea->....
